title: Unworkable on Motorola droid maxx
comment: Backspace key types previous word repeatedly, deletes some characters, then types them in again. Double tap on a word only selects one character, not the whole word. Unusable, otherwise it looks pretty cool.

title: Outdated and buggy within 1st minute
comment: What is this nonsense? I can't believe people hail this monstrosity as "the best editor". It looks ugly, has a serious and obvious backspacing bug, and hasn't been updated in more than 2 years. And I've only used it for about 2 minutes :/

title: Hoping programmers see this
comment: I've got an Lg L70, it seems to have this thing going on where when i backspace to a certain point it re-copies the word i just deleted. Its frustrating as hell. I've been using this for a couple years and used this on other phones before and didn't have this problem. Normally I'd give it 5 stars. I hope if I rate low the programmers will see this and help me out with my dilemma

title: Ads free, but with a bug
comment: It's ads free, what gives it a great advantage over others. The interface is clean and well done. On the down side, it suffers from the same problem almost all text editors for Android do (included here the paid ones): it cannot search through UTF-16 little-endian without BOM files (such as VCF generated by some applications).

title: Great
comment: This is good if you have to type a lot of stuff. Update...one of only a few apps i always take from phone to phone. Does anyone know what the box in the bottom right corner does?

title: Text Warrior Works On Tablets Too!
comment: I have used Text Warrior on several Tablets. It has performed flawlessly on all of them.  With the Android virtual keyboard it is easy to check spelling. It works fine with a hard keyboard.  To access options and settings press the three vertical dots on the bottom of the display.  Text Warrior is the best editor for large text files. If you are using another editor you will want to add this editor anyway and keep your other editor.    It should be remembered that this app is for text files. It is NOT a word processor.   If you are writing HTML text it will work, it just won't highlight. Hopefully  the developer will add HTML highlighting. When saving a file the first time you are in complete control of the filename extension but you must remember to supply the extention. Letting you supply the extention makes it possible to edit and create all sorts of programming files. These are usually text files.With Android 4.2.2 the Google Keyboard backspace key does not work properly. One solution is to uninstall updates to Google Keyboard. The other is a third party keyboard. For large Tablets use Hacker's keyboard. For phones and small tablets use Smart Keyboard.

title: Nice Editor
comment: It's such a shame that it appears to be abandoned by the developer. No updates for over a year, now :(

title: A powerful general text editor.
comment: The app is far more versatile than meats the eye at first glance. There are no drop down menus like in Windows. Instead a pop-up menu appears across the screen when the menu key is used.  The More selection selection brings up a pop-uo menu which includes a big HTML help document. Also of note is the powerful clapboarding feature and the five ways to move the cursor. I prefer trackball. Note: there is a problem with the backspace key with Google Keyboard.  Use Hackers keyboard, Smart Keyboard or another third party keyboard. Uninstalling the updates on Google keyboard works with Android 4.1 and 4.2. if you turn off automatic update on Google Keyboard.

title: Innovative, but...
comment: Awesome features and also fast BUT literally useless to me without ability to edit ROOT files because i still have to keep multiple text editors installed.. therefore Text Warrior will never make the cut.   :'-(

title: Doesn't work with SwiftKey
comment: The backspace deletion key on the Swift key keyboard doesn't delete when within text warrior. It inserts previous characters instead. So now I'm typing with the keyboard that came with the phone since I didn't take the trouble to change back to my preferred Swift key keyboard. I don't like having to keep switching Swift key off and on.

title: Would love to use this app
comment: Love it.

title: Good.
comment: Option menus and text selection could use some polish but it is a rock solid editor. Onscreen "trackpad" is awesome.

title: A very clever text editor!
comment: There are some terrific features bundled in this app. For example: highlighting text on a smaller touch screen can be a nuisance. Enter Text Warrior, offering not just one but *multiple* solutions. Obviously it isn't a full-blown word processor, but this works better than some full word processors I've encountered. Great stuff!

title: Not bad, missing an essential setting
comment: This app would be a lot more useful if I could disable BOM when saving files that I want to ftp to servers where they're not understood.

title: Can't enter backtick (`)
comment: I need to use the SYM key to enter backticks in my documents. There is no backtick in the menu, and no apparent way to change the symbols presented with the SYM key. I write using reStructuredText, so this is a blocker.

title: The best text editor
comment: I wouldn't necessarily have used this except that it was one of the editor choices in Mintoris Basic. I had already used Jota and wasn't particularly impressed. Well I am glad that I was led to this text editor as I personally found it the best. Particularly like the trackpad feature.
Nice

title: The best text editor for tablet
comment: Sure it takes a bit of learning but its worth it... very advanced features to make it easy. The more I use it the more I like it! Awesome, thanks devs!

title: Very good features
comment: Very good features and extremely user friendly. Thanks first the application.

title: Good editor
comment: But doesn't support keyboard commands like Ctrl+a for copy paste work.

title: Not very useable
comment: Positioning and selecting text on the screen is cumbersome and not very responsive.

title: I wish the update was a little sooner...
comment: I can't believe I wasted money on Jota+.  I kept this app around for a very long time and got rid of it just before the update.  Now, I'm kicking myself!  But, I'm still keeping it.  Keep up the good work and I can't wait to try your new keyboard.  I would like to see an optional toolbar, though.

title: Good editor
comment: I found many editors buggy on my galaxy note 2 but this works OK.

title: Not user friendly
comment: Way too difficult to figure out - what downloaded doesn't look at all like the depictions above AND for some strange reason I could not find it - to uninstallit in my apps area- had to go to Play Store to do it...weird!

title: Excellent
comment: Very handy, excellent app!

title: Disrecard.
comment: You need to clear the data after you update the app. That will stop it from crashing.  Update: You're welcome. I was hoping I could kill two birds with one stone so to speak. Keep up the good work.

Thank you so much for reporting this and offering advice to others on how to work around it. The crash on launch has now been fixed, so this workaround is no longer needed. However, note that the latest update will erase recent file history.

title: This worked yesterday...
comment: An excellent editor! Reliable and fast. Too bad it crashes on launch since today's update... Still 5/5. Edit: This bug was fixed within minutes of me reporting it!
Thank you so much for reporting this. The crash on launch has now been fixed.

title: Good little editor
comment: Print function would make it greater.

title: Ok
comment: Ok

title: Great program BUT...
comment: It's a shame that an ability this useful isn't available for use with .doc documents.  Please add the ability to save .doc documents.  Everyone will love you for it.

title: Missing some features but ok
comment: And ads free

title: Good
comment: Excellent

title: Unsafe save
comment: Worked on a file during some otherwise idle time. Saved and removed usb device. Opened file latter to discover that entire contents of file was wiped. This after several saves editing file. Overwriting an open file with an empty file is unacceptable. Uninstalling.

Hi  Charles Oblender,

We are sorry to hear that you have lost your data. We want to do the best we can to fix this error. If you could spare the time to share with us further details, we can help others avoid a similar situation. You can contact us by email through the link on the app description.

title: Almost perfect
comment: Really awesome text editor. Copy & paste functionality is outstanding. Unfortunately it lacks tabbing and has no hunspell support.

title: The app deleted an entire content of my file
comment: When the phone accidentaly unmounted my memory card, the app overwrote the SAVED file on the memory card with an empty file, causing me to lose weeks of work. I can live with the constant crashes and the loss of a small amount of UNSAVED data, but deleting an entire saved file is simply unacceptable. Uninstalling.

Hi ,

We are sorry to hear that you have lost your data. We want to do the best we can to fix this error. If you could spare the time to share with us further details, we can help others avoid a similar situation. You can contact us by email through the link on the app description.
Great

title: For making this...
comment: You are godly.

title: Sweet!
comment: Thank you!!
This app isn't perfect for authors, but it succeds where SkyArts Editor fails in creating easily locatable documents.

title: This is the one!
comment: Been searching for a cut & paste app for weeks and none of them did what I needed - which was cut & paste. This one works great. Hurry, get it NOW!

title: Great!
comment: Amazing. Definitely a hidden gem.   Haha.   Dave: Open the pod bay doors, HAL.   HAL: Im sorry Dave, im afraid I cant do that.

title: Pretty good, but quirky and no SU
comment: Navigation is a bit quirky - won't let me use the optical joystick/trackball on my HTC Droid Incredible and text selection can be difficult.  Other than that, it works better than the others I have tried so far.  Would give it 4/5 if it had a su (superuser) option, so I could edit preference files etc. on my rooted phone without it just telling me it couldn't open the file.

title: G
comment: I like

title: No ctrl-arrow navigation
comment: Doesn't have ctrl-arrow navigation that I rely on.

title: Wow.
comment: Doesn't seem to understand text entry at all. Maybe needs an ICS update?

title: Really nice.
comment: Easy to use. Solid app. Could use some more syntax highlighting languages (XML needed!!!).

title: No work with swipe
comment: No work with swipe. No word wrap. Scroll not effective with large files.

title: Had a nasm after days of looking for notepad.
comment: Perfect, stores files where and how i say and works with file manager. Most traditional notepad options available. Still want NP++ but this is a 5r.

title: Not Compatible With Virtual Keyboards
comment: While useful for what I wanted it for, Text Warrior is not compatible with my onscreen keyboard... the text that I type disappears behind the keyboard with no way to scroll down to see what I'm typing... My score will rise when some sort of work around is created.

title: Two thumbs up
comment: Huff...finally i found this gorgeous application.
Best text editor I've used.
Excellent. Needs to remember the last directory and needs a share menu
Excellent!

title: Good, but...
comment: Needs support for rtf or doc files, and does not display correct characters (ex " turns into ?) in txt files. Wish I could find an actual word processor...

title: Nice app
comment: Kewel

title: Fantastic for what I needed
comment: The only recommendation for a feature would be to allow auto detect of the syntax highlighting mode based on file extension.  For viewing files with the highlighting on it is great, heaven't really scratched the surface of everything else out can do yet.

title: Potentially good, but...
comment: Introduces invalid chars for android builds.

title: Thank you
comment: Its been 2 hours. Ty finally found one

title: Arc s
comment: Almost beats olive office by supporting swype horizontal keyboard but cant seem to save files as .doc format, thus rendering it pointless.

title: Amazing did just what I wanted
comment: This is the best app for. Js files and others of extreme sizes, I was looking for an app like this for hours!

title: excellent
comment: has all i need so far. best yet

title: Camel cases everything
comment: Apparently the dev is too retarded to try the app to the most basic feature--typing. Who knew!

title: potential
comment: this would be an awesome word document app, but there are no margin settings, APA formating options, I can only use this for it's word counting abilities. Cursor is great on Asus Transformer(original) add more to this app, glad it's free. But it is surely promising.

title: unfortunate
comment: doesn't work with SwiftKey and double-tap selection is flaky at best.  was a good idea but lacks followthrough by devs.
No syntax highlighting for html? Seriously? Otherwise decent.

title: Point(er)less
comment: Cursor is unpredictable at best. Typing is functional, but editing is a nightmare. HTC Incredible.

title: On Xperia mini pro (full keyboard)
comment: Caps lock fail Looked promising but when 'Aa' is active it never switches to small letters after the first. All then capitalized = annoying

title: Highlight fail
comment: None of the cursors allow me to highlight text effectively. Using Swype on an LG Optimus V, highlighting text is essential for correcting words.

title: Great App
comment: Exactly what I was looking for. Nice and simple for basic txt notes. Perfect.

title: Scroll problem
comment: Landscape view eventually causes text to appear behind the keyboard and there's no way to scroll down to see what you're typing. *On Droid incredible
Great! I've tried so many editors before this one. I use with "Hacker's Keyboard" for code editing.
Didnt think that it was very good...
Great to have a functioning text editor, copy paste, easy text selection. Great App.
Great app, wrote my dissertation outline using this. Auto-save is huge improvement.

title: Text Editor I've Needed
comment: The keyboard is still slow, but this now allows real typing for simple text documents.

title: Awesome
comment: Its great, like notepad++ or gedit for the android.

title: Open source... and shut
comment: The interface is good, but apparently task switching is too much to ask. When you come back, you find that the app has abruptly lost all your unsaved changes, "probably" due to "low memory," but more likely due to a serious flaw in the code. I wish I'd figured this out before I lost over 30 minutes of hard work and sure, I might blame myself. But I'm afraid that an unadvertised need to save compulsively on *the* definitive, task-switching mobile OS is a serious enough shortcoming to earn you 1 star.
very useful when reviewing codes and doing quick edits on the go. not helpful when creating codes from scratch unless you have a dedicated keyboard.
The best editor by far and open source!! Would be good to be able to select more than one select options. Also syntax highlighting for bash scripts:)
Awesome for fast editing

title: Best source code editor for Android tablets
comment: This is the best source code editor available in the market today for Android tablets. It works really well on a Xoom tablet. The syntax highlighting feature worked well for Python code. The application provides several different innovative methods for navigating through the text. I really enjoy using the trackpad technique. Selection of text is a lot easier using this app as compared to the native method provided by Android. Feature request: increase/decrease indentation of selected text and SL4A support.
Add word wrap and this app is five star.
Please add custom fore/back colors.
An option for word wrap would make this the one to beat.
So close to being the best basic text editor out there. Works with and saves standard txt files etc. However the lack of word wrap really is a pity.
No documentation - not even how to find a file once saved. Even the best UI can't overcome that.
Droid 2: neither capitalization nor shifting for special characters or numbers works. Uninatalling
Promising, but no word wrap is a deal breaker. Uninstalling.

title: This is simple the best text editor ever.
comment: After the last update loving the volume keys to move the cursor. Works very well with Hacker's Keyboard on a phone. Could do with full screen mode in landscape though. Thanks 5*.
I'm very glad I've found a syntax highlighting text editor for Android! Makes it easier to review code on the move.

title: Word Wrap
comment: Love the app, but please add some word wrap. Please please please
This is hands down the best text editor I've found. If there's a better one, I ain't seen it yet...
Word wrap please and also please improve scrolling speed. Looking forward to new updates.
